intro: Kefersteinia perlonga, commonly known as the long-stemmed kefersteinia, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its tall, slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Kefersteinia perlonga is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various garden conditions.
